result.markdown:
--- title: "The QI Equation: Two Complementary Views" --- ## Why Two Equations? The QI equation is presented in two complementary forms: - **Candidate 1 (Additive/Engineering):** Modular, intuitive, each term independently computable. For BCI engineers building real systems. - **Candidate 2 (Tensor/Theoretical):** Mathematically rigorous, entanglement natural, decoherence emergent. For physicists evaluating the framework. Both produce compatible security assessments. They are two lenses on the same reality. ## Candidate 1: The Engineering Equation $$QI(t) = \alpha \cdot C_{class} + \beta \cdot (1 - \Gamma_D(t)) \cdot [Q_i + \delta \cdot Q_{entangle}] - \gamma \cdot Q_{tunnel}$$ where $\Gamma_D(t) = 1 - e^{-t/\tau_D}$ ::: {#cell-fig-qi-decoherence .cell execution_count=2} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![QI score over time: quantum terms fade as decoherence progresses. The shaded region shows the quantum contribution — it's strongest when t << τ_D and vanishes as the system decoheres.](07-qi-equation_files/figure-html/fig-qi-decoherence-output-1.png){#fig-qi-decoherence width=949 height=563} ::: ::: ### Live Computation Demo Change any input and the QI score updates: ::: {#tbl-qi-demo .cell tbl-cap='QI Equation Output Across Decoherence Timescales' execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
Camp τ_D Quantum Gate QI Score
0 Tegmark (skeptic) 10⁻¹³ s 0.0000 0.7500
1 Recent experimental 10⁻⁵ s 0.9048 1.3381
2 Fisher (optimist) Hours 1.0000 1.4000
``` ::: ::: ## Candidate 2: The Theoretical Equation $$QI = C_{class} \otimes e^{-S_{quantum}}$$ where $S_{quantum} = S_{vN}(\rho(t)) + \lambda \cdot \Phi_{tunnel} - \mu \cdot E(\rho_{AB})$ The security metric is: $S_{QI} = \text{Tr}(\hat{QI} \cdot \rho_{total})$ ## Comparing the Two Candidates ::: {#tbl-comparison .cell tbl-cap='Candidate Comparison' execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html}
Property Candidate 1 (Additive) Candidate 2 (Tensor)
0 Audience BCI engineers Physicists, theorists
1 Structure Sum of terms Tensor product
2 Decoherence Explicit gate ΓD(t) Emerges from SvN(ρ(t))
3 Entanglement Added term (δ·Qentangle) Natural via E(ρAB)
4 Calibration params 4 (α, β, γ, δ) 2 (λ, μ)
5 Measurability Each term independent Requires state tomography
6 Computational cost Low High
7 Intuition High Low (requires QM background)
``` ::: ::: ## Sensitivity Analysis {#sec-sensitivity} Which parameters drive the QI score most? A one-at-a-time sensitivity analysis sweeps each parameter ±50% from baseline while holding all others constant. ::: {#cell-fig-tornado .cell execution_count=5} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Tornado plot: sensitivity of QI score to ±50% parameter variation. Longer bars indicate parameters that most strongly influence the security assessment.](07-qi-equation_files/figure-html/fig-tornado-output-1.png){#fig-tornado width=950 height=564} ::: ::: ### Decoherence Time vs Elapsed Time The core physics question — does quantum protection survive long enough to matter? This heatmap shows QI as a function of both τ_D (decoherence time) and t (elapsed time since state preparation). ::: {#cell-fig-heatmap-tau-t .cell execution_count=6} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Heatmap: QI score as a function of decoherence time (τ_D) and elapsed time (t). The diagonal where t ≈ τ_D marks the transition from quantum-protected (upper-left) to classical (lower-right).](07-qi-equation_files/figure-html/fig-heatmap-tau-t-output-1.png){#fig-heatmap-tau-t width=897 height=658} ::: ::: ### Classical vs Quantum Weight Trade-off ::: {#cell-fig-heatmap-alpha-beta .cell execution_count=7} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Heatmap: QI score as α (classical weight) and β (quantum weight) vary. The balance between classical and quantum contributions determines overall security posture.](07-qi-equation_files/figure-html/fig-heatmap-alpha-beta-output-1.png){#fig-heatmap-alpha-beta width=733 height=660} ::: ::: ::: {.callout-important title="Key Finding"} The QI score is most sensitive to **Ĉ_class** (the classical coherence metric) and **α** (its weight), confirming that classical signal integrity is the foundation of the framework. The quantum terms provide additional security margin when decoherence times are favorable, but the classical baseline dominates. **Experimental priority: determine τ_D in vivo** — this single measurement would most dramatically narrow the framework's uncertainty. :::
